title: Philip Hammond – 2019 Belt and Road Forum Speech
author: admin
summary: Below is the text of the speech made by Philip Hammond, the Chancellor of the Exchequer, in China on 26 April 2019.
content:
[![](https://www.ukpol.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/philiphammond-1.jpg)](https://www.ukpol.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/philiphammond-1.jpg)
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product
  *[UCL]: University College London
  *[HIV]: human immunodeficiency virus
  *[AI]: artificial intelligence
  *[ABI]: Association of British Insurers
  *[CMU]: Capital Markets Union
  *[IMO]: International Maritime Organization
  *[MARPOL]: International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships.
  *[UK]: United Kingdom
  *[IGF]: International Code of Safety for Ships using Gases or other Low-flashpoint Fuels
  *[COP]: Paris Climate Conference
  *[AOA]: The Airport Operators Association
  *[BATA]: British Air Transport Association
  *[OECD]: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
  *[PISA]: Programme for International Student Assessment
  *[PIRLS]: Progress in International Reading Literacy Study
  *[TIMSS]: Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study
  *[DCMS]: Department for Digital Culture Media & Sport
  *[CEOs]: chief executive officers
  *[HR]: human resources
  *[NASBM]: National Association of School Business Management
  *[CAMHS]: Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services
  *[EPPSE]: Effective pre-school, primary and secondary education
  *[LAs]: local authorities
  *[PVIs]: private, voluntary and independents

Excellencies; Ladies and Gentlemen. It’s a pleasure to be back in China for this second Belt and Road Forum. To take stock of how the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) has evolved over the past two years…
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product
  *[UCL]: University College London
  *[HIV]: human immunodeficiency virus
  *[AI]: artificial intelligence
  *[ABI]: Association of British Insurers
  *[CMU]: Capital Markets Union
  *[IMO]: International Maritime Organization
  *[MARPOL]: International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships.
  *[UK]: United Kingdom
  *[IGF]: International Code of Safety for Ships using Gases or other Low-flashpoint Fuels
  *[COP]: Paris Climate Conference
  *[AOA]: The Airport Operators Association
  *[BATA]: British Air Transport Association
  *[OECD]: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
  *[PISA]: Programme for International Student Assessment
  *[PIRLS]: Progress in International Reading Literacy Study
  *[TIMSS]: Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study
  *[DCMS]: Department for Digital Culture Media & Sport
  *[CEOs]: chief executive officers
  *[HR]: human resources
  *[NASBM]: National Association of School Business Management
  *[CAMHS]: Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services
  *[EPPSE]: Effective pre-school, primary and secondary education
  *[LAs]: local authorities
  *[PVIs]: private, voluntary and independents

…to discuss the next phase of the Initiative.
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product

  *[LAs]: local authorities
  *[PVIs]: private, voluntary and independents

To hear, as we have of China’s commitment to the BRI not only to deliver much-needed economic infrastructure, but to demonstrate leadership in addressing social and environmental ‎challenges too;
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product
  *[UCL]: University College London
  *[HIV]: human immunodeficiency virus
  *[AI]: artificial intelligence

  *[CMU]: Capital Markets Union
  *[IMO]: International Maritime Organization
  *[MARPOL]: International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships.
  *[UK]: United Kingdom
  *[IGF]: International Code of Safety for Ships using Gases or other Low-flashpoint Fuels
  *[COP]: Paris Climate Conference
  *[AOA]: The Airport Operators Association

  *[CAMHS]: Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services
  *[EPPSE]: Effective pre-school, primary and secondary education
  *[LAs]: local authorities

We have all seen how China’s own development has lifted hundreds of millions of its citizens out of poverty in just four decades…

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations

…and none of us doubts that the Belt and Road Initiative has tremendous potential to spread prosperity and sustainable development – touching, as it does, potentially 70% of the world’s population.

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals

..and the determination with which it has been pursued.
